arabic: قَالَا رَبَّنَا ظَلَمْنَا أَنفُسَنَا وَإِن لَّمْ تَغْفِرْ لَنَا وَتَرْحَمْنَا لَنَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْخَاسِرِينَ
transliteration: Rabbana zalamna anfusana wa in lam taghfir lana wa tarhamna lanakunna mina al-khasirin.
english: Our Lord, we have wronged ourselves. If You do not forgive us and have mercy on us, we will be among the losers.
turkish: Rabbimiz! Kendimize zulmettik. Bizi bağışlamaz ve bize merhamet etmezsen, kaybedenlerden oluruz.
context: In the Qur’an (7:23), Adam and Hawwa turn to Allah, admitting their wrong and asking for forgiveness and mercy.
reflection: Use this dua to own mistakes and ask Allah’s mercy without excuses.

arabic: رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي وَلِوَالِدَيَّ وَلِمَن دَخَلَ بَيْتِيَ مُؤْمِنًا وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَالْمُؤْمِنَاتِ وَلَا تَزِدِ الظَّالِمِينَ إِلَّا تَبَارًا
transliteration: Rabbi ighfir li wa liwalidayya wa liman dakhala baytiya mu'minan wa lil-mu'minina wal-mu'minat wa la tazid al-zalimin illa tabara.
english: My Lord, forgive me, my parents, whoever enters my home as a believer, and all believing men and women. Do not increase the wrongdoers except in ruin.
turkish: Rabbim! Beni, anne babamı, evime mümin olarak girenleri ve tüm mümin erkekleri ile mümin kadınları bağışla; zalimlerin helakini artır.
context: In the Qur’an (71:28), Nuh prays for forgiveness for himself, his parents, and all believing men and women.
reflection: Include family and the wider ummah in your prayers for forgiveness.

arabic: رَبِّ لَا تَذَرْ عَلَى الْأَرْضِ مِنَ الْكَافِرِينَ دَيَّارًا
transliteration: Rabbi la tadhar 'ala al-ardi mina al-kafirina dayyara.
english: My Lord, do not leave upon the earth any dwelling of the disbelievers.
turkish: Rabbim! Yeryüzünde inkârcılardan tek bir kimseyi bırakma.
context: In the Qur’an (71:26), Nuh asks Allah to end persistent disbelief and corruption.
reflection: When oppression persists, ask Allah to establish justice while staying patient.

arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ أَنْ أَسْأَلَكَ مَا لَيْسَ لِي بِهِ عِلْمٌ وَإِلَّا تَغْفِرْ لِي وَتَرْحَمْنِي أَكُن مِّنَ الْخَاسِرِينَ
transliteration: Rabbi inni a'udhu bika an as'alaka ma laysa li bihi ilm wa illa taghfir li wa tarhamni akun mina al-khasirin.
english: My Lord, I seek refuge in You from asking what I have no knowledge of. If You do not forgive me and have mercy on me, I will be among the losers.
turkish: Rabbim! Bilmediğim şeyi Senden istemekten Sana sığınırım. Beni bağışlamaz ve bana merhamet etmezsen kaybedenlerden olurum.
context: In the Qur’an (11:47), Nuh seeks refuge after being corrected and asks for Allah’s forgiveness and mercy.
reflection: Accept correction with humility and return to Allah.

arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ انصُرْنِي بِمَا كَذَّبُونِ
transliteration: Rabbi ansurni bima kadhdhabun.
english: My Lord, help me because they have denied me.
turkish: Rabbim! Beni yalanlamalarına karşı bana yardım et.
context: In the Qur’an (23:26), Nuh asks Allah for help against those who denied his message.
reflection: Seek Allah’s help when facing rejection for truth.

arabic: وَقُل رَّبِّ أَنزِلْنِي مُنزَلًا مُّبَارَكًا وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ الْمُنزِلِينَ
transliteration: Rabbi anzilni munzalan mubarakan wa anta khayru al-munzilin.
english: My Lord, grant me a blessed landing, for You are the best of those who grant landing.
turkish: Rabbim! Beni bereketli bir menzile indir. Sen indirenlerin en hayırlısısın.
context: In the Qur’an (23:29), Nuh asks for a blessed landing after being saved.
reflection: Ask Allah’s blessing when entering a new phase or place.

arabic: رَبِّ اجْعَلْ هَٰذَا بَلَدًا آمِنًا وَارْزُقْ أَهْلَهُ مِنَ الثَّمَرَاتِ مَنْ آمَنَ مِنْهُم بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الْآخِرِ
transliteration: Rabbi ij'al hadha baladan amina warzuq ahlahu mina al-thamarat man amana minhum billahi wal-yawm al-akhir.
english: My Lord, make this a secure city and provide its people with fruits—those among them who believe in Allah and the Last Day.
turkish: Rabbim! Burasını güvenli bir belde yap ve Allah’a ve ahiret gününe iman eden halkını meyvelerle rızıklandır.
context: In the Qur’an (2:126), Ibrahim prays for a secure city and provision for its believing people.
reflection: Pray for safety and lawful provision for your community.

arabic: رَبَّنَا تَقَبَّلْ مِنَّا إِنَّكَ أَنتَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ
transliteration: Rabbana taqabbal minna innaka anta al-sami'u al-'alim.
english: Our Lord, accept from us; indeed, You are the All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
turkish: Rabbimiz! Bizden kabul buyur; şüphesiz Sen işiten ve bilensin.
context: In the Qur’an (2:127), Ibrahim and Ismail ask Allah to accept their service while raising the Ka‘bah.
reflection: Seek Allah’s acceptance for every act of worship.

arabic: رَبَّنَا وَاجْعَلْنَا مُسْلِمَيْنِ لَكَ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِنَا أُمَّةً مُّسْلِمَةً لَّكَ وَأَرِنَا مَنَاسِكَنَا وَتُبْ عَلَيْنَا إِنَّكَ أَنتَ التَّوَّابُ الرَّحِيمُ
transliteration: Rabbana waj'alna muslimayni laka wa min dhurriyyatina ummatan muslimatan laka wa arina manasikana wa tub 'alayna innaka anta al-tawwab al-rahim.
english: Our Lord, make us Muslims devoted to You, and from our descendants a Muslim community. Show us our rites and accept our repentance.
turkish: Rabbimiz! Bizi Sana teslim olanlardan kıl; soyumuzdan da Sana teslim bir ümmet çıkar. Bize ibadet yollarımızı göster ve tövbemizi kabul et.
context: In the Qur’an (2:128), Ibrahim and Ismail ask for steadfast submission and guidance in worship.
reflection: Ask Allah to keep your worship sincere and guide your family.

arabic: رَبَّنَا وَابْعَثْ فِيهِمْ رَسُولًا مِّنْهُمْ يَتْلُوا عَلَيْهِمْ آيَاتِكَ وَيُعَلِّمُهُمُ الْكِتَابَ وَالْحِكْمَةَ وَيُزَكِّيهِمْ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ
transliteration: Rabbana wab'ath fihim rasulan minhum yatlu 'alayhim ayatika wa yu'allimuhum al-kitab wal-hikmah wa yuzakkihim innaka anta al-'aziz al-hakim.
english: Our Lord, send among them a messenger who will recite Your verses, teach the Book and wisdom, and purify them.
turkish: Rabbimiz! Onların arasına kendilerinden bir elçi gönder; ayetlerini okusun, Kitabı ve hikmeti öğretsin, onları arındırsın.
context: In the Qur’an (2:129), Ibrahim asks for a messenger to teach and purify his descendants.
reflection: True guidance comes through revelation and teaching—ask Allah for it.

arabic: رَبِّ اجْعَلْ هَٰذَا الْبَلَدَ آمِنًا وَاجْنُبْنِي وَبَنِيَّ أَن نَّعْبُدَ الْأَصْنَامَ
transliteration: Rabbi ij'al hadha al-balad amina wajnubni wa baniyya an na'bud al-asnam.
english: My Lord, make this city secure and keep me and my children away from worshiping idols.
turkish: Rabbim! Bu beldeyi güvenli kıl; beni ve çocuklarımı putlara tapmaktan uzak tut.
context: In the Qur’an (14:35), Ibrahim asks Allah to secure the city and protect his family from idolatry.
reflection: Ask Allah to safeguard faith for yourself and your family.

arabic: رَبِّ إِنَّهُنَّ أَضْلَلْنَ كَثِيرًا مِّنَ النَّاسِ فَمَن تَبِعَنِي فَإِنَّهُ مِنِّي وَمَنْ عَصَانِي فَإِنَّكَ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
transliteration: Rabbi innahunna adlalna kathiran mina al-nas fa man tabi'ani fa innahu minni wa man 'asani fa innaka ghafur rahim.
english: My Lord, idols have led many people astray. Whoever follows me is of me, and whoever disobeys me—You are forgiving and merciful.
turkish: Rabbim! Putlar birçok insanı saptırdı. Kim bana uyarsa bendendir; kim bana karşı gelirse, şüphesiz Sen bağışlayan ve merhamet edensin.
context: In the Qur’an (14:36), Ibrahim acknowledges the misguidance of idols and entrusts people to Allah’s mercy.
reflection: Hold to truth while relying on Allah’s mercy for others.

arabic: رَبَّنَا إِنِّيٓ أَسْكَنْتُ مِن ذُرِّيَّتِي بِوَادٍ غَيْرِ ذِي زَرْعٍ عِندَ بَيْتِكَ الْمُحَرَّمِ رَبَّنَا لِيُقِيمُوا الصَّلَاةَ فَاجْعَلْ أَفْئِدَةً مِّنَ النَّاسِ تَهْوِيٓ إِلَيْهِمْ وَارْزُقْهُم مِّنَ الثَّمَرَاتِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَشْكُرُونَ
transliteration: Rabbana inni askantu min dhurriyyati biwadin ghayri dhi zar'in 'inda baytika al-muharram rabbana liyuqimu al-salah faj'al af'idatan mina al-nas tahwi ilayhim warzuqhum mina al-thamarat la'allahum yashkurun.
english: Our Lord, I have settled some of my descendants in a barren valley near Your Sacred House so they may establish prayer. Make hearts incline toward them and provide them with fruits so they may be grateful.
turkish: Rabbimiz! Soyumdan bir kısmını, namazı dosdoğru kılsınlar diye Beyt-i Haram’ın yanında ekinsiz bir vadiye yerleştirdim. İnsanların kalplerini onlara yönelt ve onları meyvelerle rızıklandır ki şükretsinler.
context: In the Qur’an (14:37), Ibrahim mentions settling his descendants near the Sacred House and prays for hearts and provision.
reflection: Communities need both devotion and provision—ask Allah for both.

arabic: رَبِّ اجْعَلْنِي مُقِيمَ الصَّلَاةِ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِي رَبَّنَا وَتَقَبَّلْ دُعَاءِ
transliteration: Rabbi ij'alni muqima al-salah wa min dhurriyyati rabbana wa taqabbal du'a.
english: My Lord, make me an establisher of prayer, and from my descendants. Our Lord, accept my supplication.
turkish: Rabbim! Beni namazı dosdoğru kılanlardan eyle; soyumdan da. Rabbimiz, duamı kabul buyur.
context: In the Qur’an (14:40), Ibrahim asks to be steadfast in prayer and for his descendants to do the same.
reflection: Ask Allah to make prayer consistent across generations.

arabic: رَبَّنَا اغْفِرْ لِي وَلِوَالِدَيَّ وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ يَوْمَ يَقُومُ الْحِسَابُ
transliteration: Rabbana ighfir li wa liwalidayya wa lil-mu'minina yawma yaqumu al-hisab.
english: Our Lord, forgive me, my parents, and the believers on the Day the account is established.
turkish: Rabbimiz! Hesap görüleceği gün beni, anne babamı ve müminleri bağışla.
context: In the Qur’an (14:41), Ibrahim asks forgiveness for himself, his parents, and the believers on the Day of Account.
reflection: Remember the Hereafter and include others in your prayers.

arabic: رَبِّ هَبْ لِي حُكْمًا وَأَلْحِقْنِي بِالصَّالِحِينَ
transliteration: Rabbi hab li hukman wa alhiqni bil-salihin.
english: My Lord, grant me sound judgment and join me with the righteous.
turkish: Rabbim! Bana hikmet ver ve beni salihlerle birlikte kıl.
context: In the Qur’an (26:83), Ibrahim asks for sound judgment and to be joined with the righteous.
reflection: Seek wisdom and righteous company to stay on the right path.

arabic: وَاجْعَل لِّي لِسَانَ صِدْقٍ فِي الْآخِرِينَ
transliteration: Waj'al li lisan sidqin fi al-akhirin.
english: Grant me a truthful reputation among later generations.
turkish: Sonraki nesiller arasında benim için doğru bir ün nasip et.
context: In the Qur’an (26:84), Ibrahim asks for a truthful reputation among later generations.
reflection: Aim for a legacy of truthfulness, not fame.

arabic: وَاجْعَلْنِي مِن وَرَثَةِ جَنَّةِ النَّعِيمِ
transliteration: Waj'alni min warathati jannat al-na'im.
english: Make me among the heirs of the Garden of Bliss.
turkish: Beni nimet cennetinin mirasçılarından eyle.
context: In the Qur’an (26:85), Ibrahim asks to be among the inheritors of the Garden of Bliss.
reflection: Let your goals be anchored in the Hereafter.

arabic: وَاغْفِرْ لِأَبِي إِنَّهُ كَانَ مِنَ الضَّالِّينَ
transliteration: Waghfir li abi innahu kana mina al-dallin.
english: Forgive my father; he was among those who went astray.
turkish: Babamı bağışla; o sapkınlardan olmuştu.
context: In the Qur’an (26:86), Ibrahim asks forgiveness for his father.
reflection: Pray for your family with compassion while staying within Allah’s guidance.

arabic: وَلَا تُخْزِنِي يَوْمَ يُبْعَثُونَ
transliteration: Wa la tukhzini yawma yub'athun.
english: Do not disgrace me on the Day they are resurrected.
turkish: Diriltilecekleri gün beni mahcup etme.
context: In the Qur’an (26:87), Ibrahim asks not to be disgraced on the Day of Resurrection.
reflection: Ask Allah for honor and safety on the Day of Judgment.

arabic: رَبِّ هَبْ لِي مِنَ الصَّالِحِينَ
transliteration: Rabbi hab li mina al-salihin.
english: My Lord, grant me a righteous child.
turkish: Rabbim! Bana salih bir evlat bağışla.
context: In the Qur’an (37:100), Ibrahim asks Allah to grant him a righteous child.
reflection: Ask for children who bring you closer to Allah.

arabic: رَبِّ اشْرَحْ لِي صَدْرِي
transliteration: Rabbi ishrah li sadri.
english: My Lord, expand my chest for me.
turkish: Rabbim! Gönlümü genişlet.
context: In the Qur’an (20:25), Musa begins his supplication by asking Allah to expand his chest.
reflection: Ask Allah for inner strength when carrying responsibility.

arabic: وَيَسِّرْ لِي أَمْرِي
transliteration: Wa yassir li amri.
english: Make my task easy for me.
turkish: İşimi bana kolaylaştır.
context: In the Qur’an (20:26), Musa asks Allah to make his task easy.
reflection: Turn to Allah for ease in difficult duties.

arabic: وَاحْلُلْ عُقْدَةً مِّن لِّسَانِي
transliteration: Wahlul 'uqdatan min lisani.
english: Untie the knot from my tongue.
turkish: Dilimin düğümünü çöz.
context: In the Qur’an (20:27), Musa asks for clarity of speech.
reflection: Seek Allah’s help to communicate truth clearly.

arabic: يَفْقَهُوا قَوْلِي
transliteration: Yafqahu qawli.
english: So they may understand my speech.
turkish: Sözümü anlasınlar.
context: In the Qur’an (20:28), Musa asks that his speech be understood.
reflection: Pray that your message is received with understanding.

arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي وَلِأَخِي وَأَدْخِلْنَا فِي رَحْمَتِكَ وَأَنتَ أَرْحَمُ الرَّاحِمِينَ
transliteration: Rabbi ighfir li wa li akhi wa adkhilna fi rahmatika wa anta arham al-rahimin.
english: My Lord, forgive me and my brother and admit us into Your mercy; You are the most merciful of the merciful.
turkish: Rabbim! Beni ve kardeşimi bağışla; bizi rahmetine dahil et. Sen merhametlilerin en merhametlisisin.
context: In the Qur’an (7:151), Musa asks forgiveness for himself and his brother and seeks Allah’s mercy.
reflection: Ask Allah’s mercy for yourself and those you love.

arabic: وَاكْتُبْ لَنَا فِي هَٰذِهِ الدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةً وَفِي الْآخِرَةِ إِنَّا هُدْنَا إِلَيْكَ
transliteration: Waktub lana fi hadhihi al-dunya hasanatan wa fi al-akhirati inna hudna ilayk.
english: Decree for us goodness in this world and in the Hereafter; we have turned to You.
turkish: Bu dünyada da ahirette de bize güzellik yaz; biz Sana yöneldik.
context: In the Qur’an (7:156), Musa asks for goodness in this life and the Hereafter while turning to Allah.
reflection: Balance worldly needs with hope for the Hereafter.

arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي ظَلَمْتُ نَفْسِي فَاغْفِرْ لِي فَغَفَرَ لَهُ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْغَفُورُ الرَّحِيمُ
transliteration: Rabbi inni zalamtu nafsi faghfir li faghafara lahu innahu huwa al-ghafur al-rahim.
english: My Lord, I have wronged myself, so forgive me. And He forgave him; indeed He is the Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.
turkish: Rabbim! Kendime zulmettim, beni bağışla. Allah onu bağışladı; şüphesiz O çok bağışlayan, çok merhamet edendir.
context: In the Qur’an (28:16), Musa admits his wrongdoing and asks Allah’s forgiveness.
reflection: Admit mistakes quickly and seek Allah’s pardon.

arabic: رَبِّ نَجِّنِي مِنَ الْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِينَ
transliteration: Rabbi najjini mina al-qawmi al-zalimin.
english: My Lord, save me from the wrongdoing people.
turkish: Rabbim! Beni zalim topluluktan kurtar.
context: In the Qur’an (28:21), Musa asks to be saved from wrongdoing people.
reflection: Seek Allah’s protection when facing injustice.

arabic: رَبِّ إِنِّي لِمَا أَنزَلْتَ إِلَيَّ مِنْ خَيْرٍ فَقِيرٌ
transliteration: Rabbi inni lima anzalta ilayya min khayrin faqir.
english: My Lord, I am truly in need of any good You send down to me.
turkish: Rabbim! Bana indireceğin her türlü hayra muhtacım.
context: In the Qur’an (28:24), Musa asks for any good that Allah sends down.
reflection: Recognize your dependence on Allah’s provision.

arabic: رَبَّنَا إِنَّكَ آتَيْتَ فِرْعَوْنَ وَمَلَأَهُ زِينَةً وَأَمْوَالًا فِي الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا رَبَّنَا لِيُضِلُّوا عَن سَبِيلِكَ رَبَّنَا اطْمِسْ عَلَىٰ أَمْوَالِهِمْ وَاشْدُدْ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ فَلَا يُؤْمِنُوا حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُا الْعَذَابَ الْأَلِيمَ
transliteration: Rabbana innaka atayta fir'awna wa mala'ahu zinatan wa amwalan fi al-hayat al-dunya rabbana liyudillu 'an sabilika rabbana itmis 'ala amwalihim wa ushdud 'ala qulubihim fala yu'minu hatta yaraw al-'adhab al-alim.
english: Our Lord, You have given Pharaoh and his chiefs splendor and wealth in worldly life so they mislead from Your way. Our Lord, obliterate their wealth and harden their hearts so they will not believe until they see the painful punishment.
turkish: Rabbimiz! Firavun’a ve ileri gelenlerine dünya hayatında süs ve mal verdin; böylece Senin yolundan saptırıyorlar. Rabbimiz! Mallarını yok et, kalplerini sıkılaştır ki acı azabı görmedikçe iman etmesinler.
context: In the Qur’an (10:88), Musa and Harun ask Allah to restrain Pharaoh’s misguidance and oppression.
reflection: Ask Allah to end wrongdoing and protect people from being led astray.

arabic: فَنَادَىٰ فِي الظُّلُمَاتِ أَن لَّا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا أَنتَ سُبْحَانَكَ إِنِّي كُنتُ مِنَ الظَّالِمِينَ
transliteration: La ilaha illa anta subhanaka inni kuntu mina al-zalimin.
english: There is no god but You; exalted are You. I was indeed among the wrongdoers.
turkish: Senden başka ilah yok; Seni her türlü eksiklikten tenzih ederim. Ben zalimlerden oldum.
context: In the Qur’an (21:87), Yunus calls upon Allah, affirming tawhid and admitting his wrongdoing.
reflection: In distress, return to Allah with tawhid and repentance.

arabic: أَنِّي مَسَّنِيَ الضُّرُّ وَأَنتَ أَرْحَمُ الرَّاحِمِينَ
transliteration: Anni massaniya al-durru wa anta arham al-rahimin.
english: Adversity has touched me, and You are the most merciful of the merciful.
turkish: Bana sıkıntı dokundu; Sen merhametlilerin en merhametlisisin.
context: In the Qur’an (21:83), Ayyub mentions his hardship and appeals to Allah’s mercy.
reflection: When tested, speak to Allah with humility and hope.

arabic: رَبِّ إِنِّي مَسَّنِيَ الشَّيْطَانُ بِنُصْبٍ وَعَذَابٍ
transliteration: Rabbi inni massaniya al-shaytanu binusbin wa 'adhab.
english: My Lord, Satan has touched me with hardship and suffering.
turkish: Rabbim! Şeytan bana yorgunluk ve azap dokundurdu.
context: In the Qur’an (38:41), Ayyub describes his suffering and turns to Allah for help.
reflection: Present your hardship to Allah and seek His relief.

arabic: رَبِّ هَبْ لِي مِن لَّدُنكَ ذُرِّيَّةً طَيِّبَةً إِنَّكَ سَمِيعُ الدُّعَاءِ
transliteration: Rabbi hab li min ladunka dhurriyyatan tayyibatan innaka sami'u al-du'a.
english: My Lord, grant me from Yourself a good offspring. You are the Hearer of supplication.
turkish: Rabbim! Bana katından temiz bir nesil bağışla; Sen duayı işitensin.
context: In the Qur’an (3:38), Zakariya asks Allah for good offspring.
reflection: Ask Allah for righteous family and trust His timing.

arabic: فَهَبْ لِي مِن لَّدُنكَ وَلِيًّا
transliteration: Fahab li min ladunka waliyyan.
english: So grant me from Yourself an heir.
turkish: Katından bana bir veli bağışla.
context: In the Qur’an (19:5), Zakariya asks for a successor from Allah.
reflection: Pray for successors who preserve faith.

arabic: رَبِّ لَا تَذَرْنِي فَرْدًا وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ الْوَارِثِينَ
transliteration: Rabbi la tadharni fardan wa anta khayru al-warithin.
english: My Lord, do not leave me without an heir; You are the best of inheritors.
turkish: Rabbim! Beni tek başıma bırakma; Sen varislerin en hayırlısısın.
context: In the Qur’an (21:89), Zakariya asks not to be left without an heir.
reflection: Bring your deepest hopes to Allah with patience.

arabic: رَبِّ قَدْ آتَيْتَنِي مِنَ الْمُلْكِ وَعَلَّمْتَنِي مِن تَأْوِيلِ الْأَحَادِيثِ فَاطِرَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ أَنتَ وَلِيِّي فِي الدُّنْيَا وَالْآخِرَةِ تَوَفَّنِي مُسْلِمًا وَأَلْحِقْنِي بِالصَّالِحِينَ
transliteration: Rabbi qad ataytani mina al-mulk wa 'allamtani min ta'wil al-ahadith fatir al-samawati wal-ard anta waliyyi fi al-dunya wal-akhirah tawaffani musliman wa alhiqni bil-salihin.
english: My Lord, You have granted me authority and taught me interpretation. Creator of the heavens and earth, You are my Protector in this world and the Hereafter. Let me die as a Muslim and join me with the righteous.
turkish: Rabbim! Bana hüküm verdin ve rüya yorumunu öğrettin. Göklerin ve yerin yaratıcısı! Dünyada da ahirette de dostum Sensin. Beni Müslüman olarak vefat ettir ve beni salihlerle birlikte kıl.
context: In the Qur’an (12:101), Yusuf thanks Allah for authority and knowledge and asks for a faithful end.
reflection: Let blessings lead you to gratitude and a righteous conclusion.

arabic: رَبِّ أَوْزِعْنِي أَنْ أَشْكُرَ نِعْمَتَكَ الَّتِي أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَيَّ وَعَلَىٰ وَالِدَيَّ وَأَنْ أَعْمَلَ صَالِحًا تَرْضَاهُ وَأَصْلِحْ لِي فِي ذُرِّيَّتِي إِنِّي تُبْتُ إِلَيْكَ وَإِنِّي مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ
transliteration: Rabbi awzi'ni an ashkura ni'mataka allati an'amta 'alayya wa 'ala walidayya wa an a'mala salihan tardah wa aslih li fi dhurriyyati inni tubtu ilayka wa inni mina al-muslimin.
english: My Lord, enable me to be grateful for Your favor upon me and my parents, and to do righteous deeds that please You. Set my offspring right; I turn to You, and I am among the Muslims.
turkish: Rabbim! Bana ve anne babama verdiğin nimetlere şükretmeyi ve razı olacağın salih ameller yapmayı nasip et. Soyumu ıslah et. Sana yöneldim ve Müslümanlardanım.
context: In the Qur’an (27:19), Sulaiman asks to be grateful and to do deeds pleasing to Allah.
reflection: Pair gratitude with action that Allah loves.

arabic: رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي وَهَبْ لِي مُلْكًا لَا يَنبَغِي لِأَحَدٍ مِّن بَعْدِي إِنَّكَ أَنتَ الْوَهَّابُ
transliteration: Rabbi ighfir li wa hab li mulkan la yanbaghi li ahadin min ba'di innaka anta al-wahhab.
english: My Lord, forgive me and grant me a kingdom that none after me will have. You are the Bestower.
turkish: Rabbim! Beni bağışla ve benden sonra kimseye verilmeyecek bir hüküm ver. Sen çok vericisin.
context: In the Qur’an (38:35), Sulaiman asks forgiveness and a unique kingdom by Allah’s gift.
reflection: Seek Allah’s forgiveness even when granted power.

arabic: اللَّهُمَّ رَبَّنَا أَنزِلْ عَلَيْنَا مَائِدَةً مِّنَ السَّمَاءِ تَكُونُ لَنَا عِيدًا لِّأَوَّلِنَا وَآخِرِنَا وَآيَةً مِّنكَ وَارْزُقْنَا وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ الرَّازِقِينَ
transliteration: Allahumma rabbana anzil 'alayna ma'idatan mina al-sama'i takunu lana 'idan li-awwalina wa akhirina wa ayatan minka warzuqna wa anta khayru al-raziqin.
english: O Allah, our Lord, send down to us a table from heaven to be a festival for the first and last of us and a sign from You. Provide for us; You are the best of providers.
turkish: Allah’ım, Rabbimiz! Gökten bize bir sofra indir; bize bayram olsun ve Senden bir ayet olsun. Bizi rızıklandır; Sen rızık verenlerin en hayırlısısın.
context: In the Qur’an (5:114), Isa supplicates for a table from heaven as a sign and provision.
reflection: Ask Allah for provision with gratitude and awareness of His signs.

arabic: رَبِّ نَجِّنِي وَأَهْلِي مِمَّا يَعْمَلُونَ
transliteration: Rabbi najjini wa ahli mimma ya'malun.
english: My Lord, save me and my family from what they do.
turkish: Rabbim! Beni ve ailemi onların yaptıklarından kurtar.
context: In the Qur’an (26:169), Lut asks Allah to save him and his family from what his people do.
reflection: Seek Allah’s protection for your family amid harmful surroundings.

arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي ظَلَمْتُ نَفْسِي ظُلْمًا كَثِيرًا وَلَا يَغْفِرُ الذُّنُوبَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ فَاغْفِرْ لِي مَغْفِرَةً مِنْ عِنْدِكَ وَارْحَمْنِي إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الْغَفُورُ الرَّحِيمُ
transliteration: Allahumma inni zalamtu nafsi zulman kathiran wa la yaghfiru al-dhunuba illa anta faghfir li maghfiratan min 'indika warhamni innaka anta al-ghafur al-rahim.
english: O Allah, I have greatly wronged myself, and none forgives sins except You. Forgive me and have mercy on me; You are the Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.
turkish: Allah’ım! Kendime çok zulmettim; günahları ancak Sen bağışlarsın. Beni bağışla ve bana merhamet et; Sen çok bağışlayan, çok merhamet edensin.
context: In Sahih al-Bukhari (834), the Prophet ﷺ taught Abu Bakr to say this in prayer when seeking forgiveness and mercy.
reflection: Use this dua in prayer when asking Allah for sincere forgiveness.

arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابِ جَهَنَّمَ وَمِنْ عَذَابِ الْقَبْرِ وَمِنْ فِتْنَةِ الْمَحْيَا وَالْمَمَاتِ وَمِنْ شَرِّ فِتْنَةِ الْمَسِيحِ الدَّجَّالِ
transliteration: Allahumma inni a'udhu bika min 'adhabi jahannam wa min 'adhabi al-qabr wa min fitnati al-mahya wal-mamat wa min sharri fitnati al-masih al-dajjal.
english: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from the punishment of Hell, the punishment of the grave, the trials of life and death, and the evil of the Antichrist.
turkish: Allah’ım! Cehennem azabından, kabir azabından, hayat ve ölüm fitnelerinden ve Deccal fitnesinin şerrinden Sana sığınırım.
context: In Sahih Muslim (843), the Prophet ﷺ instructed this supplication for protection from major trials and punishments in prayer.
reflection: Recite it to seek Allah’s protection from unseen and future trials.

arabic: اللَّهُمَّ أَصْلِحْ لِي دِينِيَ الَّذِي هُوَ عِصْمَةُ أَمْرِي وَأَصْلِحْ لِي دُنْيَايَ الَّتِي فِيهَا مَعَاشِي وَأَصْلِحْ لِي آخِرَتِيَ الَّتِي فِيهَا مَعَادِي
transliteration: Allahumma aslih li diniya alladhi huwa 'ismatu amri wa aslih li dunyaya allati fiha ma'ashi wa aslih li akhirati allati fiha ma'adi.
english: O Allah, set right for me my religion which safeguards my affairs, set right for me my worldly life in which is my living, and set right for me my Hereafter to which is my return.
turkish: Allah’ım! İşlerimin teminatı olan dinimi düzelt; geçimimin olduğu dünyamı düzelt; dönüşümün olduğu ahiretimi de düzelt.
context: In Sahih Muslim (2720), it is reported that the Prophet ﷺ would supplicate for rectification of religion, worldly life, and the Hereafter.
reflection: Ask Allah to set right all dimensions of life, not just one.

arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْهُدَى وَالتُّقَى وَالْعَفَافَ وَالْغِنَى
transliteration: Allahumma inni as'aluka al-huda wa al-tuqa wa al-'afaf wa al-ghina.
english: O Allah, I ask You for guidance, piety, chastity, and contentment.
turkish: Allah’ım! Senden hidayet, takva, iffet ve gönül zenginliği dilerim.
context: In Sahih Muslim (2721), it is reported that the Prophet ﷺ would ask for guidance, piety, chastity, and contentment.
reflection: Prioritize inner character alongside material needs.

arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْهَمِّ وَالْحَزَنِ وَالْعَجْزِ وَالْكَسَلِ وَالْبُخْلِ وَالْجُبْنِ وَضَلَعِ الدَّيْنِ وَغَلَبَةِ الرِّجَالِ
transliteration: Allahumma inni a'udhu bika min al-hamm wal-hazan wal-'ajz wal-kasal wal-bukhl wal-jubn wa dala' al-dayn wa ghalabat al-rijal.
english: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from anxiety and grief, incapacity and laziness, miserliness and cowardice, the burden of debt, and being overpowered by people.
turkish: Allah’ım! Hüzün ve kederden, acizlik ve tembellikten, cimrilik ve korkaklıktan, borç yükünden ve insanların baskısından Sana sığınırım.
context: In Sahih al-Bukhari (6369), it is reported that the Prophet ﷺ would seek refuge from anxiety, laziness, and overpowering debt.
reflection: Seek Allah’s refuge from inner burdens and social pressures.
